metadata.Title: CVE-2023-29533 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description: A website could have obscured the fullscreen notification by using a combination of window.open, fullscreen requests, window.name assignments, and setInterval calls. This could have led to user confusion and possible spoofing attacks. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 112, Focus for Android < 112, Firefox ESR < 102.10, Firefox for Android < 112, and Thunderbird < 102.10. Update Instructions: Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-29533` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions: firefox - 112.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1 firefox-geckodriver - 112.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1 firefox-mozsymbols - 112.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1 Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro thunderbird - 1:102.10.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1 thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:102.10.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1 thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:102.10.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1 xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:102.10.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1 xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:102.10.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1 xul-ext-lightning - 1:102.10.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1 Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

notes.Note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine mdeslaur> starting with Ubuntu 22.04, the firefox package is just a script that installs the Firefox snap

criterions.comment: firefox package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '112.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
mozjs38 package in bionic is affected and may need fixing.
mozjs52 package in bionic is affected and may need fixing.
thunderbird package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:102.10.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
